svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2021-11-22T10:14:48.461Z" agent="5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/96.0.4664.45 Safari/537.36" etag="02d2UBK-F2NsjSC7r-9P" version="15.8.2" type="device"><diagram id="Ju5ZWNbm8nMhDvztTQXh" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 378px; height: 1px; padding-top: 93px; margin-left: 1272px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

font.font:
As the target is only on pixels clipped at 0, there is no propagation of gradient
--> no Learning (zero progress toward target)

switch.text: As the target is only on pixels clipped at 0, there is no propa...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 378px; height: 1px; padding-top: 360px; margin-left: 1272px;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

font.span: The target overlaps pixels >0 which propagates gradient as they're not clipped.

span.style: color: rgb(61 , 60 , 64) ; text-align: left ; background-color: rgba(61 , 60 , 64 , 0.04)
span.font: (the creature learns to go a bit further toward target)
